document_data.caption: A thief fleeing along the covered Canary Lane.
document_data.name: Canary Lane
document_data.mainbody: '''Canary Lane''' was a short and unwelcoming street just one block away from [[The Eastern Wet]] in the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]].
document_data.Description:
[[File:Baldur's Gate Manhole.png|thumb|''A manhole on Canary Lane.''|320x320px]]
Canary Lane ran one block, from south to north, one block southwest from the [[Sailor's Crossing]] plaza decorated with a small fountain,

Canary Lane was a shaded and covered lane, crossed by dark alleyways that did manholes and grate passages into the city's [[Baldur's Gate/Sewers|sewers]].
document_data.History: In the summer of the {{YearlinkName|1477}}, on [[Kythorn 19]], the Sailor's Crossing plaza became a scene of a grizzly murder. An adventuring detective named [[Tav]] conducted the investigation when a cloaked figure of a thief darted past, carrying a [[coin]] purse stolen from the murder victim. On [[Kythorn 22]], Tav ventured to Canary Lane in an attempt to track down the thief, who was considered a prime suspect. The investigator chased down a young urchin nicknamed [[Magpie (thief)|Magpie]] who ended up slipping past drain grates into the sewers, marked with the symbol of [[The Guild]].
